intro: Cleisostoma platystele, commonly known as the broad-stemmed hooded orchid, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, hood-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid tropical environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged in a rosette pattern. Cleisostoma platystele blooms with showy, fragrant flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
